description: Taylor Head Provincial Park sits along Marine Drive between Spry Bay and Sheet Harbour. With three main trails, sandy beach, and picnic area this park offers something for everyone. Hiking the trails you will see various wildlife as well as panoramic views of Mushaboom Harbour and Spry Bay. From Dartmouth drive along the 107 (Main Street) until you come to Marine Drive. Take a right and follow Marine along a very scenic twisty road until you get to Spry Bay. The entrance, Taylor Park Road, will be on your right. Following Taylor Park Road you will pass a few drives to your right, one is the start of the Bull Beach Trail. The main parking is all the way at the end and provides entrances for two trails; Spry Bay Trail and Headland Trail as well as the picnic area and beach.
directions: From Dartmouth drive along the 107 (Main Street) until you come to Marine Drive. Take a right and follow Marine along a very scenic twisty road until you get to Spry Bay. The entrance, Taylor Park Road, will be on your right.
title: Taylor Head Provincial Park
